title: After Firefox refresh I am encouraged to install dubious .exe file.
content: I have just refreshed Firefox. Various tabs pop open from different add-ons I've installed. Including one from Google Translator for Firefox, on an external server: http://translatorforfirefox.blogspot.com//p/whats-new.html It exhorts me to install an exe file Translator.exe viz "translator (pass 123).zip" Is this legit?
creator: karl.self

title: Phishing by phone and email
content: I recently had an attack by a phishing expedition via email. I had to, at the banks recommendation, change account numbers etc. I did click, to my chagrin, on a link within the email (from my bank, or so it said). Since then I have had further attempts by email to access my computer/banking info. This morning 5 minutes after a purchase via PayPal I received a phishing phone call! Too much of a coincidence for my liking! I have Big Sur as system software, Malwarebytes, and I use Firefox and Safari. Primarily Firefox. I have had a sudden seizing up/ultra slowdown within Firefox...to a lesser degree Safari. What to do?

title: FB Messenger doesn't function properly under latest version of FireFox Browser
content: I use FireFox quite some time on my iMac. With the version V89.0.1 I have problems with FaceBook Messenger videochat. The screen of the partner stays black. I only see my own little video screen on a black screen. Normally after allowing my camera and my mike to be used I get a message: Calling And when answered the other partner shows up on large screen. Now the text is different : Something like : Waiting for other partner to join. And the large screen stays black. The other partner can see and hear me. I tried with another browser (Brave) and then all functions well. But Brave doesn't support the Picture-in-Picture function that FireFox has. Till last week I could use the Picture-in-Picture function in Messenger Videochat. It was great to have the minimized video screen of the videopartner on top of all other programs I open.
creator: j.h.g.welman

title: Imported certificate doesn't get checked / served on the relevant URLs
content:
Hi,

I need to connect to a couple of secure URLs for my job, for which I need a valid and authorized .p12 certificate. I have a valid file, which works fine on chrome browsers. I've imported the certificate into Firefox, but when I visit the URLs I get a 403 error without any prompt to use a certificate (screenshot included). On another of our URLs, I can see the icon that signifies that no certificate has been found.

I have tried to disable the Enhanced Tracking Protection for these URLs.

Why doesn't Firefox serve my certificate ? Any way to fix this ? I'm trying to use Firefox as my work browser, but this is making it pretty difficult.

Thanks.
creator: alix.ladent

title: Firefox Nightly not auto updating in Linux
content: Firefox Nightly cannot be found in the 'Software' store, so probably the only way to download it is by going to the website and getting a tar.bz2 file. I got that, extrated it and placed it in the/opt folder, made an application shortcut, added an icon, and now it's working like a normal app. The problem arises when it tries to auto-update. Firefox Nightly updates very frequently, sometimes more than once per day, and on windows, I used to get a notification saying that a new update is released, and if i wanted to install it. Clicking yes, Firefox would update and restart within moments, and restore all my tabs and windows seamlessly. Here on Linux, I have to manually download the new tar.bz2 file, extract it, replace it in the specified folder, and launch Firefox Nightly again, and again and again usually once per every alternate day, whenever the new update comes. Is there a solution for this? Will Firefox someday release a .deb file for easy installation and updates? My PC : Dell Optiplex 3070 OS : Zorin OS 16 Core (based on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS)
creator: singhgere

title: Firefox unbearably slow page load.
content:
It started about two week ago (after the last update).

ANY page, literally - a n y - page "starts" to load after about 5-10 seconds. The browser does absolutely nothing for a couple of seconds when typing an address or using a link. It shows me a spinner in the tab, and after about 5-10 seconds the page magically appears.

I've tried literally everyhing with no effect whatsoever. Any other program runs super fast on my pc (I have a I7 4770k, 32gs of ram, gtx 1660 super, ssd drives and a 300Mb/s fibre connection). I cannot work since FF is my default browser for over 15 years. If i cannot fix this, i'm done with it forever.

Can anyone suggest anything (other than "upgrade your pc/internet connection" or "restart your computer")?

Thank you in advance.
creator: jarek.marciniak

title: Update made Youtube videos stop playing properly
content:
Since the upgrade to 89, I have a problem with Youtube that, judging by Google results, nobody else on earth has.

If I click on a video, it starts to play normally but as soon as the page finishes loading the video stops and returns to the start of the video. I have to click the play button to get it to play, which it then does without any issues.

The same problem happens when videos are part of one of Youtube's playlists. Video starts, page finishes loading, video stops and goes back to the start.

I've been through too many Google searches, tried about:config changes, policy changes, toggling autoplay in Youtube, installed extensions that supposedly control autoplay. Nothing works.

This was not a problem with 88 when I first had it. When 89 first appeared, I was so frustrated with the wasteful display setup that I uninstalled Firefox and went back to 88; this was when the Youtube issue first appeared. I upgraded back to 89 when I found out how to turn off Proton (because my Bookmark menu shouldn't mostly wasted vertical space) but the Youtube problem persists.

Somebody, please tell me how to fix this.
creator: OilCanHarry

title: bookmark folders
content: After I synced my bookmarks from my old computer to my new computer my folders are missing when I click on the bookmark star so I can't direct a bookmark to the appropriate folder... and I now have the same problem on my old computer! I have been trying to fix this for 4 hours!!
creator: walden7r

title: Desconexiones continuadas de Gmail
content: Muy buenas. Hace una semana que Google me recomendó cambiar la contraseña por una brecha de seguridad. Lo hice y, desde entonces, cada media hora me desconecta y me solicita volver a introducir la contraseña para verificar mi identidad (adjunto captura de pantalla). Se está volviendo muy molesto, puesto que ocurre incluso cuando estoy redactando un correo. Sólo me sucede con Firefox, no con otros navegadores (Chrome), por lo que entiendo que es algún problema específico. He intentado borrar las cookies, cerrar e iniciar de nuevo el navegador, el ordenador, reiniciar Firefox en Modo Seguro, cambiar la configuración de Seguridad, pero nada de eso soluciona el problema. Sólo me resta desinstalar o reiniciar Firefox a su configuración original, pero antes de recurrir a algo tan drástico (que no sé si arreglará el problema), quería consultar por si alguien puede ofrecer alguna otra posible solución o explicación a lo que sucede. Muchas gracias.
creator: mcfistle

title: Broken window layout on when opening browser in Ubuntu Linux (KDE)
content:
Hello.

I got a little problem with firefox starting with somewhat broken window layout on my Ubuntu 20.04 desktop with KDE desktop environment. Tried to google for it unsuccessfully, so here I am. Whenever I start firefox after cold boot or a full reboot, it runs like on a screenshot. The workaround for fixing that is to resize window and then make it maximized again. I am not quite sure, is it a problem of browser, video driver, or desktop environment, but it occurs for me only on firefox.

  • Appeared several versions ago, present on current version I use: 89.0.2 (64-bit)
  • Does not appear when i load windows 10 on this PC.
  • Video card: Nvidia 1660S driver ver.460

Does anyone heard of that problem? Would be glad to know any details to address this problem.

title: error open google.com
content:
why when i open the google.com i get the message www.google.com has a security policy called HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS), which means that Firefox can only connect to it securely. You can’t add an exception to visit this site.

The issue is most likely with the website, and there is nothing you can do to resolve it.

If you are on a corporate network or using anti-virus software, you can reach out to the support teams for assistance. You can also notify the website’s administrator about the problem.

Learn more…

title: Google search in address bar not working correctly
content:
Hi there,

After a certain period of time browsing, if I try to search for something by typing in the address bar, the google search page does not load. If i keep spamming the enter key to force it, it eventually loads after maybe 20 tries. If i close and reopen firefox the search will work reliably again for a short time before the issue happens again. All of the other search engines (amazon, duckduckgo etc) work fine.

Have tried reinstalling firefox but issue persists. Seemed to start happening after a recent update a week or so ago.

Can you assist?

Many Thanks
